intro: Temnadenia semidigyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved temnadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptic or ovate in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and are clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
